> Ooh what are (All) the reasons people can get banned for... just curious... I've seen some banned accounts. Does that mean temporary or permanent?
> Hopefully asking this isn't against the rules if so... sorry, theres always a delete

Pretty much any of the community rules can get you banned if you try hard enough. And you do have to try, by being repetitive and ignoring moderation attempts. (Unless you are a spammer or a duplicate account, those are not tolerated at all.)

There is no way for regular users to see if a user is banned temporarily or permanently, I'm afraid.

I'd like to add that bans are pretty rare on the forums. I don't have an up-to-date count but earlier this year I cleaned the banlist (removing the spam accounts from it etc..) and we had 60-some permanent bans for real people in total. Currently there's one temporary ban active.

It's not that easy, the controls for banning are separate from the others so you cant accidentally ban someone, though any member who racks up more than 100 active infraction points will be automatically banned while the total exceeds 100.

Infractions have point values of 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, and 30, depending on severity. There's also a "custom" infraction which can be any number of points we enter, but that's almost never used.

Stupid? :/

Its a *personal* signature. One that is typed every single post. Not something you type once and its always there, automatically. It's like signing the bottom of a letter. Usually you don't stamp a preset signature onto a letter, or anything you've written. And if you do use a stamp, usually you sign anyways.
